sentence.text: Devotees of Pevsner know , on opening a volume of The Buildings of England , to look for the section headed ` Perambulation " for whichever town or village in which they happen to find themselves .
` To howl down a man just because he happens to be out of form one day is often sufficient to discourage him for all time , " he told the Yorkshire Evening Post .
It was n't purely coincidental that she happened to be carrying the details of previous work experience , for she 'd expected that the secretarial agency might want to see them .
It never enters her head that it is n't Dieter , she happens to have a golf-club in her hand and the temptation is overwhelming . "
Her heart was beating wildly as it had for days whenever the telephone bell rang anywhere she happened to be .
She happened to be my fiancée .
She happened to have a period for most of that week .
They are going it alone not only because they happened to " get caught out " , but because it is an alternative to aimless adolescence on the dole .
The key to social satisfaction is in meeting like-minded people with a mutual interest -- whether or not they happen to have a hearing loss is incidental .
In all seriousness , I ask the Government not to deride the strong arguments for a local income tax just because they happen to be advanced by what they call minority parties .
But we 've got to live by their rules and not expect privileges because we happen to be women . "
I could n't see many people ; most of the lights had been turned off , and we happened to be sitting in the patch of light thrown by one small lamp .
Come to think of it , that bloody M.O. gives me some very strange looks when we happen to meet .
For what it 's worth , I merely took the opportunity to discuss a radio-related matter with him when we happened to meet because I 've kept missing him at work these last couple of days .
` We happened to be in the same place at the same time a couple of months ago , " she replied , terse and offhand .
They just happened to pick on mine .
It happened that on that same night Leith had invited Rosemary to supper .
Long acquaintance with the clergy had convinced him that priests could not tell one layman from the next if they happened to be on their own administrative staff .
On the prototype a 100 VA transformer , which was unnecessarily big , but because it happened to be standing on the shelf , was used .
We happened to pass a woman pushing a pram , who for some reason produced a torch , no doubt in order to locate something , and directed it straight at the baby 's face .
